content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is how you can achieve this in Julia:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words::Vector{String})
    filter!(x -> islowercase(x[1]) == false || (islowercase(x[1]) && length(x) > 1 && x[2]==' '), words)
end
```
This function uses the `filter!` function to remove all elements in the Vector that do not meet the specified criteria. The condition checks if the first character of a word is uppercase and the whole string has more than one letter, or if the first character is an uppercase and it's followed by a space.

Testing this function with some words:
```julia
words = ["dog", "Dog", "cat", "Cat", "bird","Bird"]
keep_only_names(words)
```
The output should be `["Dog", "Cat", "Bird"]`.
Remember, this function modifies the input array in place. If you need to preserve the original list use a copy of the list:
```julia
function keep_only_names(words::Vector{String})
    filter!(x -> islowercase(x[1]) == false || (islowercase(x[1]) && length(x) > 1 && x[2]==' '), copy(words))
end
```
